metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: Git GitHub Branch
Change Platform:
Create a Branch
On GitHub, access your repository and click the "master" branch button.
content.html: On GitHub, access your repository and click the "master" branch button.

content.text: There you can create a new Branch. Type in a descriptive name, and click Create branch:
content.html: There you can create a new Branch. Type in a descriptive name, and click Create branch:

content.text: The branch should now be created and active. You can confirm which branch you are working on by looking at the branch button. See that it now says "html-skeleton" instead of "main"?
content.html: The branch should now be created and active. You can confirm which branch you are working on by looking at the branch button. See that it now says "html-skeleton" instead of "main"?

content.text: Start working on an existing file in this branch. Click the " index.html " file and start editing:
content.html: Start working on an existing file in this branch. Click the "index.html" file and start editing:

content.text: After you have finished editing the file, you can click the "Preview changes" tab to see the changes you made highlighted:
content.html: After you have finished editing the file, you can click the "Preview changes" tab to see the changes you made highlighted:

content.text: If you are happy with the change, add a comment that explains what you did, and click Commit changes.
content.html: If you are happy with the change, add a comment that explains what you did, and click Commit changes.

content.text: You now have a new branch on GitHub, updated with some changes!
content.html: You now have a new branch on GitHub, updated with some changes!

content.text: Switch Branch
To switch to another branch in GitHub's web interface, click the branch dropdown and select the branch you want to work on.
content.html: To switch to another branch in GitHub's web interface, click the branch dropdown and select the branch you want to work on.

content.text: To switch branches using the command line:
content.html: To switch branches using the command line:

content.code_html: git switch branch-name

content.text: Delete Branch
To delete a branch on GitHub, go to the branches page, find your branch, and click the delete icon (trash can).
content.html: To delete a branch on GitHub, go to the branches page, find your branch, and click the delete icon (trash can).

content.text: To delete a branch using the command line:
content.html: To delete a branch using the command line:

content.code_html: git branch -d branch-name

content.text: To delete a remote branch:
content.html: To delete a remote branch:

content.code_html: git push origin --delete branch-name

content.text: Rename Branch
To rename a branch using the command line:
content.html: To rename a branch using the command line:

content.code_html: git branch -m old-name new-name

content.text: Merge Branch
To merge a branch into another on GitHub, open a Pull Request (PR) and follow the prompts to merge.
content.html: To merge a branch into another on GitHub, open a Pull Request (PR) and follow the prompts to merge.

content.text: To merge using the command line:
content.html: To merge using the command line:

content.code_html: git merge branch-name

content.text: View Branches
To see all branches in your repository on GitHub, click the branch dropdown at the top of the file list.
content.html: To see all branches in your repository on GitHub, click the branch dropdown at the top of the file list.

content.text: To view branches using the command line:
content.html: To view branches using the command line:

content.code_html: git branch

content.text: Protected Branches
Some branches (like main ) may be protected, meaning you cannot delete or force-push to them without special permissions.
content.html: Some branches (like main) may be protected, meaning you cannot delete or force-push to them without special permissions.

content.text: This helps prevent accidental changes to important branches.
content.html: This helps prevent accidental changes to important branches.

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
